data.title: Little Rock Air Force Base
data.text:
Monday – Friday: 0800 – 1530 (includes base in-processing)

Saturday & Sunday: Closed

ID Cards & DEERS

Appointment Only: Monday, Wednesday, Friday: 0800 – 1530

Walk-In Only: Tuesday & Thursday: 0800 – 1530

MPF/DEERs is closed the first Wednesday of each month for training.

Closed on all Federal holidays.

MPF/DEERs is closed on all AMC Family Days:

APTS ONLY

20 JUN 2024

5 JUL 2024

30 AUG 2024

11 OCT 2024

8 NOV 2024

26 DEC 2024

31 DEC 2024

All personnel PCSing into LRAFB must in-process with the Welcome Center within 24 hours of arrival and before beginning any period of leave or permissive TDY.

Failure to in-process by RNLTD may affect pay and entitlements.

IMPORTANT

If the Welcome Center is closed for deployment operations etc., in-processing will restart the next duty day and will not affect sign-in/leave/travel dates.

Lost or Stolen Common Access Card (CAC)

CAC’s are accountable government property. A report of lost or stolen ID card must be provided before a replacement CAC can be issued.

Initial or Renewal

For initial issue or renewal of any type of military identification (CAC, dependent, or retiree etc.), all DEERS eligible customers must have two unexpired forms of ID to include other specific items for the type of DEERS update being requested.

All documents used for identity purposes in DEERS must be original or certified true copies only.

Of the two forms of identification required, 1 must be an unexpired state or federal issued photo ID.

Second form of ID can be either a valid drivers’ license (not the same as the 1st option), unlaminated SSN card, original or certified true copy of birth certificate, valid passport etc.

*Please contact Customer Support for a complete list of acceptable documents.

IMPORTANT

The sponsor is always required to be present for any DEERS update to a dependent’s record unless a Power of Attorney (POA) has been issued specifically authorizing the ability to update DEERS.

Homeland Security Presidential Directive (HSPD-12) and Federal Identity Processing Standard (FIPS-201) requires TWO forms of identification documents (not expired) for initial issue and replacement of ID cards.
